formula:
RACES:
Race is a competition of speed, as in running, riding, driving or sailing.

Suppose A and B are two contestants in a race. If before the start of the race, 
A is at the starting point and 
B is ahead of A by 10 metres, 
then we say that 'A gives B, a start of 10 metres'.

To cover a race of 100 metres in this case, A will have to cover 100 metres while B will have to cover only (100 - 10) = 90 metres.

In a 100m race, 
'A can give B 10 m' or 
'A gives B a start of 10 m'
means that while A runs 100 m, B runs (100-10) = 90 m.

'A beats B by 5 seconds' 
means that B finishes 5 seconds after A.

'A beats B by 10 meters or 5 seconds'
means that B was 10 meters behind when A finished.
B has covered the last 10 meters in 5 seconds.
Hence, B's speed = (10/5) = 2 m/s

* If all the contestants of the race reach the goal at the same time, then the race is called a Dead Heat Race

* If A is n times as fast as B and A gives B a start of x metres, then the distance of the winning post so that the race ends in a dead heat is
x[n/(n-1)] metres

* If A and B can run a x m race in t1 seconds and t2 seconds respectively, where t1<t2, then A beats B by a distance of
(x/t2)*(t1-t2) m

GAMES:
A game of n points, means that the person among the contestants, who scores n points first is the winner.

If A scores 100 points while B scores only 80 points, then we say that 'A can give B 20 points'.

problems.question: In a race, A beats B by 20 m or 10 seconds. Find B's speed.
problems.solution:
20 meters are covered by B in 10 seconds.

B's speed
= 20/10
= 2 m/s

problems.question: The time taken by P to run 50 m is equal to the time taken by Q to run 75 m. In a 600 m race, Q beats P by
problems.solution:
When Q runs 75 m, P runs 50 m.
When Q runs 600 m, P runs
600*50/75
400 m
Q beats P by 200 m

problems.question: A and B take part in a 100 m race. A gives B a start of 10 m and still beats B by 5 seconds. If A's speed is 2.5 m/s, find B's speed.
problems.solution:
Time taken by A to cover 100 m
= 100/2.5
= 40 seconds
A gives B a start of 10 m. Hence, B covers only 90 m.

A beats B by 5 seconds.

Hence, time taken by B to cover 90 m
= 40+5
= 45 seconds
B covers 90 m in 45 seconds.

B's speed
= 90/45
= 2 m/s

problems.question: In a 500 m race, A beats B by 40 metres or 8 seconds. Find A's time over the course.
problems.solution:
B covers 40 meters in 8 seconds.
B's speed = 40/8 = 5 m/s
Time taken by B to cover 500m
= 500/5
= 100 seconds

A beats B by 8 seconds. Hence,
Time taken by A
= 100-8
= 92 seconds

problems.question: Ram and Lakshman take part in a 200 m race. Ram beats Lakshman by 15 seconds. If Ram's speed is 2 m/s, find the time taken by Lakshman to finish the race.
problems.solution:
Time taken by Ram to finish
= 200/2
= 100 seconds
Ram beats Lakshman by 15 s.

Time taken by Lakshman to finish
= 115 seconds

problems.question: A's speed is twice B's speed. In a 100m race, how many metres start can A give B so that the race ends in a dead heat?
problems.solution:
For the race to end in a dead heat,
both A and B should reach the winning post at the same time.

A's speed is twice B's speed.

To run the same distance,
time taken by B=2*(time taken by A)

Time taken by B to run 100 m
= 2*Time taken by A to run 100 m

Time taken by B to run 50 m
= Time taken by A to run 100 m

Hence, A can give B a start of 50 m.

problems.question: The speeds of A and B are in the ratio 3:4. B gives A a start of 30 m. How far should the winning post be so that the race ends in a dead heat?
problems.solution:
Let A's speed be 3x m/s and
      B's speed be 4x m/s
Let the distance of the winning post be l m.

Time taken by A to finish the race
= (l-30)/3x
Time taken by B to finish the race
= l/4x
For the race to end in a dead heat,
(l-30)/3x = l/4x
Solving,
l = 120 m

problems.question: P can run a 500 m race in 3 minutes and Q in 3 mins 20 seconds. How many meters start can P give Q so that the race ends in a dead heat?
problems.solution:
Q takes 20 seconds more than P to run 500 m

Distance covered by Q in 3 mins 20 seconds(200 s)
= 500m
Distance covered by Q in 20 seconds
= (500/200)*20
= 50 m
If Q skips 50m, the race can be finished in 3 minutes(same as P).

Hence, for the race to end in a dead heat,
P should give Q a start of 50 m.

problems.question: The speeds of Daniel and Robert are in the ratio 3:4. In a 300 m race, Daniel has a start of 90 m. Daniel won the race by
problems.solution:
To reach the winning post,
Daniel has to run 300-90 = 210m
Time taken by Daniel to run 210m
= 210/3x
= 70/x
Distance covered by Robert in (70/x)seconds
= (70/x)*4x
= 280m
Hence, Daniel won by 20 m.

problems.question: In a 100 m race, A beats B by 10 m and C by 20 m. In a 180m race, by how many meters will B beat C?
problems.solution:
Time taken by A to cover 100 m
= time taken by B to cover 90 m
= time taken by C to cover 80 m
B:C = 90:80 = 9:8

When B covers 9 m, C covers 8 m
When B covers 180 m, 
C covers 160 m.
B beats C by 20 m.

problems.question: In a 200 m race, B beats A by 50 m and A beats C by 8 m. By how many meters did B beat C in the same race?
problems.solution:
When B runs 200m, A runs 150m.
B:A = 200:150
When A runs 200m, C runs 192 m.
A:C = 200:192
B:C = (B/A)*(A/C)
      = (200/150)*(200/192)
      = 200/144
When B covers 200m, C runs only 144 m.

Hence, B beats C by 56 m.

problems.question: In a 1 km race, A beats B by 35 metres or 7 seconds. Find B's time over the course.
problems.solution:
Distance travelled by B in 7 seconds
= 35 m
B's speed = 5 m/s

Time taken by B to cover 1 km
= 1000/5
= 200 seconds
= 3 minutes 20 seconds

problems.question: In a 100 m race, A reaches the winning post in 30 seconds and beats B by 10 m. Find the time taken by B to reach the winning post.
problems.solution:
B was 10 m behind when A finished the race.

B ran 90 m in 30 seconds.

Time taken by B to run 100 m
= 100*30/90
= 33.33 s

problems.question: In a 400 m race, A runs at 8 kmph. If A gives B a start of 16m and still beats him by 1 minute, find B's speed.
problems.solution:
8 kmph = (8*5/18) m/s

Time taken by A to run 400 m
= 400/[8*(5/18)]
= 180 s
= 3 minutes
B takes 3+1=4 minutes to complete the race.

B has a start of 16 m and hence runs only 384 m.

B's speed 
= 384/(4*60)
= 1.6 m/s

problems.question: In a 100 m race, A reaches the winning post in 40 seconds and B in 50 seconds. A beats B by
problems.solution:
B covers 100 m in 50 seconds.

Distance covered by B in 40 seconds
= 100*(40/50)

Alternatively, using the formula,
x=100 m, t1=40s, t2=50s
d=(x/t2)(t1-t2)
                  =(100/50)*10
                  = 20 m
= 80 m
B was 20 meters behind when A finished the race.

A beats B by 20 m.

problems.question: In a 200 m race, A can give B 20 m and C 56 m. In the same race, how many meters start can B give C?
problems.solution:
A:B = 200:180
A:C = 200:144

B/C = (B/A)*(A/C)
       = (180/200)*(200/144)
       = 180/144
When B runs 180 m, C runs 144 m

When B runs 200 m, C runs
144*200/180
160 m
B can give C a start of 40 m.

problems.question: In a 10 km race, P and Q complete the race in 4 minutes and 5 min 20 sec respectively. P beats Q by
problems.solution:
Q takes 5 min 20 sec (320 seconds) to run 10 km.

Distance covered by Q in 4 mins (240 s)
= 10*240/320
= 7.5 km
Q covers 7.5 km when P completes the race.

P beats Q by 2.5 km.

Alternatively, using the formula,
x=1 km, t1=240s, t2=320s
d=(x/t2)(t1-t2)
                  =(10000/320)*80
                  = 2.5 km

problems.question: A runs 1(1/3) times as fast as B. If A gives B a start of 50 m, how far must the winning post be so that the race ends in a dead heat?
problems.solution:
Let B's speed = x m/s
      A's speed = 1(1/3) x = (4x/3) m/s
Let y be the distance of the winning post.

For the race to end in a dead heat,
time taken by A to run y m = time taken by B to run (y-50) m

y/[4x/3] = (y-50)/x
3y/4 = y-50
y/4 = 50
y = 200 m

Alternatively, using the shortcut,
n=4/3, x=50

y = x[n/(n-1)]
   = 50*[(4/3)/(1/3)]
   = 50*4
   = 200m

problems.question: In a game of cards, A can give B 15 points in 60 and A can give C 20 points in 60. How many points can B give C in a game of 90?
problems.solution:
In a game of 60, while A scores 60, 
B scores 60-15=45
C scores 60-20=40
When B scores 45, C scores 40.

In a game of 90, when B scores 90, 
C scores 90*40/45=80
B can give C (90-80)=10 points.

problems.question: At a game of billiards, A can give B 6 points in 50 and he can give C 13 in 65. In a game of 55, number of points B can give C is
problems.solution:
If A gets 50 points, B gets (50-6)=44 points
A:B=50:44

If A gets 65 points, C gets (65-13)=52 points
A:C=65:52

B:C = (B/A)*(A/C)
       = (44/50)*(65/52)
       = (11/10)

If B gets 11 points, C gets 10.
If B gets 55 points, C gets 50.
Hence, in a game of 55, B can give C (55-50)=5 points

problems.question: In a 500 m race, the ratio of the speeds of two contestants A and B is 4:5. A has a start of 120 m. A beats B by
problems.solution:
Let A's speed = 4x m/s
      B's speed = 5x m/s

A has a start of 120 m.

Time taken by A to run 380 m
= 380/4x
= 95/x s
Distance covered by B in (95/x) s
= 5x*95/x
= 475 m
A beats B by 25 m.

problems.question: A and B take part in a 200m race. A runs at 5 Km/hr. A gives B a start of 10m and still beats him by 8 seconds. Find the speed of B.
problems.solution:
Time taken by A to cover 200m
= 0.2/5
= 0.04 hours
= 0.04*60*60 s
= 144s
B takes 8 seconds more than A.
Time taken by B to run 190 m = 152s
B's speed
= 190/152  m/s
= (5/4) m/s
= (5/4)*(18/5) kmph
= 4.5 kmph

problems.question: In a game of cards, A can give B 10 points in 50 and A can give C 20 points in 60. How many points can B give C in a game of 90?
problems.solution:
A:B=50:40
A:C=60:40

B:C = (B/A)*(A/C)
       = (40/50)*(60/40)
       = 60/50
If B gets 60 points, C gets 50.
If B gets 90 points, C gets
90*50/60 = 75

B can give C 25 points in a game of 90.

problems.question: The distance travelled by A in 20 seconds is equal to the distance travelled by B in 16 seconds. In a 320 m race, B beats A by
problems.solution:
A's speed = a m/s
B's speed = b m/s

Speed is inversely proportional to time taken.

a:b = 16:20 = 4:5

a=4b/5

Time taken by B to run 320 m
= 320/b
Distance travelled by A in (320/b) seconds
= a*(320/b)
= (4b/5)*(320/b)
= 256 m
B beats A by 64 m.

problems.question: In a 100 m race , P beat Q by 10 m and R by 20 m. By how many meters will Q beat R in a race of 90 m?
A completed a 500 m race in 40 seconds and beat B by 10 seconds. Find the ratio of the speeds of A and B.
problems.solution:
Time taken by A = 40 s
Time taken by B = 50 s

Ratio of speeds
= 50:40
= 5:4

problems.question: In a game of 60, A can give B 6 points. How many points can A give B in a game of 100?
problems.solution:
When A gets 60 points, B gets 54.

When A gets 100 points, B gets
54*100/60 = 90
A can give 10 points.

problems.question: A can run 800 meters in 3 minutes 20 seconds and B can cover the same distance in 2 minutes 40 seconds. Find the difference in the speeds of A and B.
problems.solution:
Time taken by A to run 800 m
= 200 seconds
A's speed
= 800/200
= 4 m/s
Time taken by B to run 800 m
= 160 s
B's speed
= 800/160
= 5 m/s
Difference in speed
= 1 m/s

problems.question: A and B take part in a 100 m race. A runs at 5 m/s and B runs at 4 m/s. A gives B a start of 8 m. A beats B by
problems.solution:
Time taken by A to run 100m
= 100/5
= 20 seconds
Time taken by B to run 92 m
= 92/4
= 23 seconds
A beats B by 3 seconds.

problems.question: In a 400 metres race A beats B by 20 metres or 5 seconds. Find the time taken by B to finish the race.
problems.solution:
B covers the last 20 meters in 5 seconds.
B's speed = 20/5 = 4 m/s
Time taken by B to cover 400m
= 400/4
= 100 seconds

problems.question: A and B run a 1 km race. If A gives B a start of 50m, A wins by 14 seconds and if A gives B a start of 22 seconds, B wins by 20 meters.Find the time taken by A to run 1 km.
problems.solution:
Let the speeds of A and B be a m/s and b m/s respectively.

Case (I):
A gives B a start of 50 m.
A wins by 14 seconds.

A runs 1000 m, while B runs only 950 m
A reached 14 seconds before B.
Distance travelled by B in 14 seconds = 14b

Hence, while A ran 1000m, 
B had completed only 950-14b m
a/b = 1000/(950-14b)

Case (II):
A gives B a start of 22 seconds.
B wins by 20 meters.

A started 22 seconds after B started.
A was 20 meters behind(980 m) when B completed 1000 m.
Distance covered by B in the first 22 seconds
= 22b

If B had also started at the same time, B would have run (1000-22b) m

a/b = 980/(1000-2b)

1000/(950-14b) = 980/(1000-22b)

Solving,
b = 25/3

a/(25/3) = 1000/[950-14*(25/3)]

a = 10 m/s

To run 1 km,
A takes 100 seconds.

problems.question: Anusha, Banu and Esha run a race of 100 meters. Anusha is the fastest followed by Banu and then Esha. Anusha, Banu and Esha maintain constant speeds during the entire race. When Anusha reached the goal post, Banu was 10m behind. When Banu reached the goal post, Esha was 10m behind. Find the distance covered by Eesha when Anusha reached the goal post.
problems.solution:
When Anusha covered 100m, Banu covered 90 m
A:B = 10:9
When Banu covered 100m, Eesha covered 90 m.
B:E = 10:9
A:E = (A:B)*(B:E) = 100:81

When Anusha covers 100m, Eesha covered 81m.

problems.question: In a 100 m race, A runs at 8 km per hour. If A gives B a start of 4 m and still wins by 15 seconds, what is the speed of B?
problems.solution:
A's speed
= 8*5/18 m/s
= 20/9 m/s
Time taken by A to run 100 m
= 100/(20/9)
= 45 seconds
A takes 15 seconds more than B to complete the race.

Since, A gives B a start of 4 m, B runs only 96 m.

B's speed
= 96/60
= 1.6 m/s
= 1.6*18/5 kmph
= 5.76 kmph

problems.question: In a game of 80 points, A can give B 5 points and C 15 points. Then how many points can B give C in a game of 60?
problems.solution:
When A gets 80 points, B gets 75 points and C gets 65 points.

When B gets 60 points, C gets
(65/75)*60 = 52 points

B can give C (60-52)=8 points

problems.question: In a 100m race, A beats B by 15m and B beats C by 10m. If A beats C by 5 seconds, then find the speed of C.
problems.solution:
When A ran 100m, B ran 85 m.

When B ran 100m, C ran 90 m.
When B ran 85m, C ran
(90/100)*85 = 76.5 m

A beats C by (100-76.5) = 23.5m
A beats C by 5 seconds.

C ran 23.5 m in 5 seconds.

C's speed
= 23.5/5
= 4.7 m/s

problems.question: Adam sat with his friends in the Chinnaswamy stadium at Madurai to watch the 100 metres running race organized by the Asian athletics Association. Five rounds were run. After every round half the teams were eliminated. Finally, one team wins the game. How many teams participated in the race?
problems.solution:
In the final round,
2 teams.
In the penultimate round,
4 teams.
In the 3rd round,
8 teams.
In the 2nd round,
16 teams.
In the 1st round,
32 teams.
